name: Discer3
description:
Note from the Developer:

My entry for the DISCJAMGAMEJAM2020. I didn't have as much time as I wanted, but I think I got to a place I am proud of.  Thought didn't get into the music or sound department.

Spent a total of 17 hours over the course of 6 days in HAXE + HEAPS.

Fullscreen for the best experience, but should run fine in the window. If its too small some of the pause text might overlap.

The pause screen should have most of the information. You can change up how you want to play from there, adjust players + change your patterns.

  • SPACE to pause / unpause
  • R to restart
  • Don't forget to press the bottom right in the pause once you change settings, it will restart the game.
  • P1 uses W,A,S,D
  • P2 uses the arrow keys
  • The room controller uses a mouse and the wheel or (-/+) to change saws
    • It should let you use the standard +/- and NUMKEYS but seems i had some issues with HTML and the standard +/- keys.
  • The game should save high scores, I'm new to HTML, tried to use local storage so maybe no persistence ?
  • Every time you place saws / make a pattern it will be saved and you can go back and play it again as a human or with the AI. When you do that you can choose to use Fixed Positions : all saws will spawn in the same locations, or Random Positions : all saws will spawn the same distance from the center, but random locations.
Description:

In the 3rd game in the series, Discer3, puts a spin (heh) on the tried and true gameplay from the first two by allow you to now BE THE ROOM. Grab a friend or two and challenge them to rooms you design, or challenge yourself or the new discers patented AI (not patented).

Done forget, the time doesn't count unless you in the timer zone!

1-3 Players

Features:

  • 5 kinds of discs with different behavior
  • Create disc room "patterns", and save them.
  • Play against AI Humans, or saved patterns
  • High scores!
  • Play with up to 2 real people (locally) and as many AI players as you want!
